thread.title: Athlete Of The Week: Bekah Powell
thread.title_full: Athlete Of The Week: Bekah Powell

title: Athlete Of The Week: Bekah Powell
text:
Courtesy photo Bret Harte Water Polo 
Defense is a hallmark of good teams and Bret Harte High School junior Bekah Powell has emerged as a polished 2-meter defender on the Bullfrogs’ girls water polo team, which recently took a fourth-place finish at the McNair Tournament in Stockton. 
“She gets the toughest defensive assignments on the team. She’ll maybe score one or two goals a game, but I always assign her to the toughest player,” said Bret Harte coach Mark Garrett. “We had a pretty good team against Stagg to play; they had a player who scores seven or eight goals a game and Bekah pretty much shut her down. Every game is like that; she’s our premier defender.” 
Powell was on the inaugural Bret Harte water polo team last season and also swam for her school since her freshman year, so she has some experience in the water. Her defense will be a leading force for the Bullfrogs as the season continues. 
“She’s tough as nails. She’s our team leader and also our team captain,” Garrett said. 
– Joe Klarer 
“She’s tough as nails. She’s our team leader and also our team captain" Get to know Bekah Powell: 
Parents: Kathleen Powell and Robert Powell 
Hometown: Tracy
